body_html:
@cy89 @isaprykin
I think it's not an Iterator error.
I substituted from_string_handle for make_initializable_iterator, but the error (silent session restarts without any failures) persisted during MonitoredTrainingSession, so I kept debugging a bit deeper.

I explicitly started to check for exceptions in session run calls here, and got an uncaught OS Error, that was causing silent restarts:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/client/session.py", line 1392, in _do_call
    return fn(*args)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/client/session.py", line 1371, in _run_fn
    target_list, status, run_metadata)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/framework/errors_impl.py", line 516, in __exit__
    c_api.TF_GetCode(self.status.status))
tensorflow.python.framework.errors_impl.UnavailableError: OS Error

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/client/session.py", line 910, in run
    run_metadata_ptr)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/client/session.py", line 1165, in _run
    feed_dict_tensor, options, run_metadata)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/client/session.py", line 1386, in _do_run
    options, run_metadata)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/client/session.py", line 1405, in _do_call
    raise type(e)(node_def, op, message)
tensorflow.python.framework.errors_impl.UnavailableError: OS Error

I could only trace it till pywrap_tensorflow.TF_PRun(). It's not clear what is wrong and what to do about it.
Is this an intended behaviour? 🤷‍♂️
Is there any way to avoid this it?

Env Info:

TF DOCKER: tensorflow/tensorflow:latest-gpu-py3
K8S CLUSTER_VERSION=1.9.4-gke.1

body:
@cy89 @isaprykin 
I think it's not an Iterator error.
I substituted `from_string_handle` for `make_initializable_iterator`, but the error (silent session restarts without any failures) persisted during `MonitoredTrainingSession`, so I kept debugging a bit deeper.

I explicitly started to check for exceptions in session run calls [here](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/client/session.py#L912), and got an uncaught `OS Error`, that was causing silent restarts:

~~~
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/client/session.py", line 1392, in _do_call
    return fn(*args)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/client/session.py", line 1371, in _run_fn
    target_list, status, run_metadata)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/framework/errors_impl.py", line 516, in __exit__
    c_api.TF_GetCode(self.status.status))
tensorflow.python.framework.errors_impl.UnavailableError: OS Error

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/client/session.py", line 910, in run
    run_metadata_ptr)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/client/session.py", line 1165, in _run
    feed_dict_tensor, options, run_metadata)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/client/session.py", line 1386, in _do_run
    options, run_metadata)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/client/session.py", line 1405, in _do_call
    raise type(e)(node_def, op, message)
tensorflow.python.framework.errors_impl.UnavailableError: OS Error
~~~

I could only trace it till `pywrap_tensorflow.TF_PRun()`. It's not clear what is wrong and what to do about it.
Is this an intended behaviour?  :man_shrugging:
Is there any way to avoid this it?


Env Info:
~~~
TF DOCKER: tensorflow/tensorflow:latest-gpu-py3
K8S CLUSTER_VERSION=1.9.4-gke.1
~~~
